Comment 1: 
gccgo runs this code w/o errors for n=0, 1, 2, 3. The first errors (due to the limits of
the internal representation of constants) appear for n=4 at which point the product
looks like this:

+1.000000e+000 +0.000000e+000 +0.000000e+000 +0.000000e+000
+0.000000e+000 +1.000000e+000 +0.000000e+000 +0.000000e+000
+0.000000e+000 +0.000000e+000 +1.000000e+000 +4.421718e-075
+0.000000e+000 +0.000000e+000 +0.000000e+000 +1.000000e+000
